declarations.name: useTRPC
declarations.description: A React hook generated by createTRPCContext for accessing tRPC procedures and utilities in React components. Provides type-safe access to the application's tRPC router.
declarations.remarks: This hook is used to interact with the tRPC API from React components, enabling queries, mutations, and subscriptions with full type safety.

definition.name: TRPCProvider
definition.purpose: Provides the tRPC context to React component trees, enabling useTRPC and other tRPC hooks within the subtree.
definition.description: A React context provider component generated by createTRPCContext for tRPC. It should wrap parts of the app that need access to tRPC hooks and context.

initial.data: No tRPC context is available until this provider is mounted.

when.description: The provider is mounted in the React tree.

effects: tRPC hooks and context become available to all children

definition.visualLayout: A context provider that wraps its children and supplies tRPC context.
definition.implementationNotes: This component is generated by createTRPCContext and should be used at the root of the React app or any subtree that needs tRPC access.
